definition: plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: Three officers from the regime's Central Security Forces, all in civilian clothing, sat down next to us.
sentences.chinese: 中央保安部隊的三名警官身着便裝，坐到我們旁邊。

sentences.english: She said she envied the casual way we dress for work.
sentences.chinese: 她說她羨慕我們可以穿便裝上班。

sentences.english: In his casual wear, Clinton favors jeans and khakis.
sentences.chinese: 就便裝而言，克林頓喜歡穿牛仔褲和卡其服裝。

sentences.english: May I ask whether we are allowed to wear casual clothes in the office?
sentences.chinese: 我可以問一下我們是否被允許穿便裝上班。

sentences.english: Don't let casual Fridays be your fashion downfall.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓星期五的便裝日成了你的時裝秀。

sentences.english: Molnar was dressed in ordinary clothes and only a winter jacket.
sentences.chinese: 莫爾納只套了便裝和一件短夾克。

sentences.english: Don't let casual Fridays be yourfashion downfall.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓星期五的便裝日成了你的時裝秀。

sentences.english: You should put on your safari suit to go hunting.
sentences.chinese: 打獵你該穿上游獵便裝。

sentences.english: 'Casual wear doesn't mean that you wear chappals (slippers) or shorts, ' says Ms. Lala.
sentences.chinese: 拉拉說，便裝並不意味着可以穿拖鞋和短褲。

sentences.english: Dress is most often informal, EXCEPT on weekends, when semi-formal attire may be worn.
sentences.chinese: 去餐館一般是穿便裝，只在週末時着半正式的服裝。

sentences.english: Taking a human form, the river-god followed closely in pursuit .
sentences.chinese: 河神便裝成凡人的樣子在後緊緊地追趕着。

definition: (of a student) to work part-time (while continuing one's studies)/(of a delinquent) to be reformed through work and study
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
sick personnel/person on the sick list/patient
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
